text: my mother abandoned me and my brother
when I was three my brother was five I
didn't see her again except for a
disastrous visit when I was seven to up
two or three months when her boyfriend
raped me at 13 I went back to her I
didn't understand there she didn't act
anything like my grandmother my
grandmother was patient time spoke
slowly Vivien pastor spoke fast and
wiggle all the time and she kept records
on and songs and music and she what
lipstick she danced and I just couldn't
get it so every fuse to call her mother
called a lady and she accepted that many
people couldn't overcome that initial
abandonment that would have been
something impossible right um what what
what allowed you to it so that establish
Wallace she loved me and she told me she
said I really wasn't ready to be a
parent and I realized here some people
who are great parents of small people my
mother was just the opposite and then I
said she was very kind to people who
maybe needed someone to be kind what are
some of the universal elements that that
you have have drawn from that
relationship a mother-daughter
relationship I learned that love heals
not sentimentality but love and her love
healed me your mother grew up in very
different times what would she make of
an african-american being in the White
House he I think would have thought it
should have been her dr. Maya Angelou
Martin Luther King told me that he
expected there to be a black president
in 40 years was 20 years ago I didn't I
thought I'd be long dead before that
happens and when my mother was that
hopeful and myself positive and an
optimist but I wouldn't have gone there
how do
I born black in a white country poor in
a society where wealth is adored and
sought-after
at all cost female in an environment
where only large ships and some engines
are described favourably by using the
female pronoun how did I get to be Maya
Angelou what I saw the lessons to take
away from this book exercise patience
with yourself first so you can forgive
yourself but all the dumb things you do
and once you do you can learn from that
so you don't have to repeat them and
then exercise patience with your
children please
I pray that someone will hear that in
this book and learn to be a little
kinder
